Name: ACTUATOR
ownedComment:
A mechanism for moving or controlling a mechanical part of a piece of equipment.   
 It takes energy usually provided by air, electric current, or liquid and converts the energy into some kind of motion.

Name: AMPLIFIER
ownedComment: An electronic component or circuit for amplifying power, electric current, or voltage.

Name: BALLSCREW
ownedComment: A mechanical structure for transforming rotary motion into linear motion.

Name: BELT
ownedComment: An endless flexible band used to transmit motion for a piece of equipment or to convey materials and objects.

Name: BRAKE
ownedComment: A mechanism for slowing or stopping a moving object by the absorption or transfer of the energy of momentum, usually by means of friction, electrical force, or magnetic force.

Name: CHAIN
ownedComment: An interconnected series of objects that band together and are used to transmit motion for a piece of equipment or to convey materials and objects.

Name: CHOPPER
ownedComment: A mechanism used to break material into smaller pieces.

Name: CHUCK
ownedComment: A mechanism that holds a part, stock material, or any other item in place.

Name: CHUTE
ownedComment: An inclined channel for conveying material.

Name: CIRCUIT_BREAKER
ownedComment: A mechanism for interrupting an electric circuit.

Name: CLAMP
ownedComment: A mechanism used to strengthen, support, or fasten objects in place.

Name: COMPRESSOR
ownedComment: A pump or other mechanism for reducing volume and increasing pressure of gases in order to condense the gases to drive pneumatically powered pieces of equipment.

Name: DOOR
ownedComment: A mechanical mechanism or closure that can cover a physical access portal into a piece of equipment allowing or restricting access to other parts of the equipment.

Name: DRAIN
ownedComment: A mechanism that allows material to flow for the purpose of drainage from, for example, a vessel or tank.

Name: ENCODER
ownedComment: A mechanism used to measure rotary position.

Name: EXPOSURE_UNIT
ownedComment: A mechanism for emitting a type of radiation

Name: EXTRUSION_UNIT
ownedComment: A mechanism for dispensing liquid or powered materials

Name: FAN
ownedComment: Any mechanism for producing a current of air.

Name: FILTER
ownedComment: Any substance or structure through which liquids or gases are passed to remove suspended impurities or to recover solids.

Name: GALVANOMOTOR
ownedComment: An electromechanical actuator that produces deflection of a beam of light or energy in response to electric current through its coil in a magnetic field.

Name: GRIPPER
ownedComment: A mechanism that holds a part, stock material, or any other item in place.

Name: HOPPER
ownedComment: A chamber or bin in which materials are stored temporarily, typically being filled through the top and dispensed through the bottom.

Name: LINEAR_POSITION_FEEDBACK
ownedComment: A mechanism that measures linear motion or position.

Name: MOTOR
ownedComment: A mechanism that converts electrical, pneumatic, or hydraulic energy into mechanical energy.

Name: OIL
ownedComment: A viscous liquid.

Name: POWER_SUPPLY
ownedComment: A unit that provides power to electric mechanisms.

Name: PULLEY
ownedComment: A mechanism or wheel that turns in a frame or block and serves to change the direction of or to transmit force.

Name: PUMP
ownedComment: An apparatus raising, driving, exhausting, or compressing fluids or gases by means of a piston, plunger, or set of rotating vanes.

Name: REEL
ownedComment: A rotary storage unit for material

Name: SENSING_ELEMENT
ownedComment: A mechanism that provides a signal or measured value.

Name: SPREADER
ownedComment: A mechanism for flattening or spreading materials

Name: STORAGE_BATTERY
ownedComment: A component consisting of one or more cells, in which chemical energy is converted into electricity and used as a source of power.

Name: SWITCH
ownedComment: A mechanism for turning on or off an electric current or for making or breaking a circuit.

Name: TABLE
ownedComment: A surface for holding an object or material

Name: TANK
ownedComment: A receptacle or container for holding material.

Name: TENSIONER
ownedComment: A mechanism that provides or applies a stretch or strain to another mechanism.

Name: TRANSFORMER
ownedComment: A mechanism that transforms electric energy from a source to a secondary circuit.

Name: VALVE
ownedComment: Any mechanism for halting or controlling the flow of a liquid, gas, or other material through a passage, pipe, inlet, or outlet.

Name: VAT
ownedComment: A container for liquid or powdered materials

Name: WATER
ownedComment: A fluid.

Name: WIRE
ownedComment: A string like piece or filament of relatively rigid or flexible material provided in a variety of diameters.
